metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5816 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Process lifetime issue in Chrome in Google Chrome on Android prior to 74.0.3729.108 allowed a remote attacker to potentially persist an exploited process via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
